intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius elatius, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 60 to 120 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium elatius is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
